segments.text: Looking at this kitchen, I can't help but feel a sense of nostalgia.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It reminds me of my own childhood, sneaking cookies with my siblings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is just like how I used to be, always trying to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I remember the thrill of trying to get away with something without getting caught.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waiting for her cookie, it's all so familiar and heartwarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I also remember the times when things didn't go as planned, like when I fell off the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Looking at that unstable stool, I feel a bit worried for the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn't fall and hurt himself like I did.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman drying the dishes, she reminds me of my own mother, always busy with chores.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she knows how much mischief her kids are getting into.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene brings back so many memories, both good and bad.
segments.speaker: PAR
